comments: Horford (BOS) slides his hand off Turner (IND) as Turner dribbles away from him at the beginning of the drive.
Brown (BOS) and Siakam (IND) come together in pursuit of the loose ball, and marginal contact occurs during the rebound.
White (BOS) initially makes legal contact with Nembhard's (IND) hand while it's in contact with the ball but then slides off and makes contact with Nembhard's other wrist.
Brown (BOS) and Nembhard (IND) engage and disengage, with both players pushing off each other.
Siakam (IND) is in Brown's (BOS) path before the contact, and any contact initiated by Siakam is the result of Tatum (BOS) on the switch.

Brown (BOS) makes clean contact with the ball and deflects it away from Siakam (IND) into the backcourt. Since the ball is deflected, the ball is loose and a player from either team may be the first to touch the ball in the backcourt.
Tatum (BOS) steps toward Siakam (IND) on his drive and changes direction to move along his path, maintaining a legal guarding position on his drive.
Holiday (BOS) gathers the ball on his right foot by bringing two hands to it. He then takes two steps afterward, his left foot and then his right before shooting.
Siakam (IND) initially makes legal contact with the ball after Holiday (BOS) gathers it, but slides across the ball without dislodging it across Holiday's arm while he's in a shooting motion.
Brown (BOS) moves alongside Nembhard's (IND) path when marginal body contact occurs as they come together at the end of the drive.
Holiday (BOS) stops short and Nembhard (IND) continues into him as the timeout is called.
Siakam (IND) plants and jumps vertically to defend Tatum's (BOS) driving shot attempt.

Holiday (BOS) moves alongside Nembhard's (IND) path when they first come together and is carried forward by Nembhard's momentum. He then deflects the ball as he steps forward into Nembhard's path. Nembhard steps on Holiday's foot after the ball is already dislodged from his control.
Siakam (IND) commits a take foul on Holiday (BOS). Since Holiday veers away from the basket to avoid the contact by Siakam, this is not a clear path foul.
McDermott (IND) and Brown (BOS) come together off-ball during the inbound as McDermott cuts toward the perimeter.
Holiday (BOS) legally defends Nesmith's (IND) jump shot. Nesmith extends his leg to the side, but the contact to Holiday is marginal.
